short_desc: The mission of the Emeryville Fire and Emergency Services Department is to protect life, property from fire, the environment, and other emergencies within the community through public education, code management and incident response
description: Provides paramedic-level emergency medical services. All firefighters are certified as Emergency Medical Technicians (EMT), and 13 firefighters are certified as Paramedics (EMT-P). This allows the department to offer Advanced and Basic Life Support as a first response from all engine companies. This gives Emeryville a unique ability to deliver emergency medical services in an average of 5 minutes or less. Safe Surrender Site available 24 hours daily, to bring newborn no more than 72 hours old. Permitting parents or legal guardians to confidentially surrender babies without fear of prosecution – no questions asked. Providing needed medical care to surrendered babies and placing them in foster or pre-adoptive homes.  Allowing parents or legal guardians that qualify to exercise a 14-day “reclaim” option.
